Line 40: Line 40:
[[Click fraud]] has also become a growing problem for Google's business strategy. Google's CFO George Reyes said in a December 2004 investor conference that "something has to be done about this really, really quickly, because I think, potentially, it threatens our business model."<ref name="crawford_cnn">Crawford, Krysten. "[http://money.cnn.com/2004/12/02/technology/Google_fraud/?cnn=yes Google CFO: Fraud a big threat]." ''[[CNN]].'' [[December 2]], [[2004]].</ref> Some have suggested that Google is not doing enough to combat click fraud. Jessie Stricchiola, president of Alchemist Media, called Google, "the most stubborn and the least willing to cooperate with advertisers," when it comes to click fraud.<ref name="crawford_cnn"/>
[[Click fraud]] has also become a growing problem for Google's business strategy. Google's CFO George Reyes said in a December 2004 investor conference that "something has to be done about this really, really quickly, because I think, potentially, it threatens our business model."<ref name="crawford_cnn">Crawford, Krysten. "[http://money.cnn.com/2004/12/02/technology/Google_fraud/?cnn=yes Google CFO: Fraud a big threat]." ''[[CNN]].'' [[December 2]], [[2004]].</ref> Some have suggested that Google is not doing enough to combat click fraud. Jessie Stricchiola, president of Alchemist Media, called Google, "the most stubborn and the least willing to cooperate with advertisers," when it comes to click fraud.<ref name="crawford_cnn"/>
â
A flurry of discussion has developed with regards to Google's use of personal information. With the development of products that increasingly retain identifiable information about it's users, such as Gmail and Google Calender, many bodies such as Google-Watch have been lobbying for greater restrictions to be placed upon Google's use of this information.
+
A flurry of discussion has developed with regards to Google's use of personal information. With the development of products that increasingly retain identifiable information about it's users, such as Gmail and Google Calendar, many bodies such as Google-Watch have been lobbying for greater restrictions to be placed upon Google's use of this information.
